Are you attempting to connect over 2.4Ghz or do you have a second radio acting as a bridge?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T22:01:39.581Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":198,"readers_count":197,"score":79.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63024,"username":"Jacksjnfds","name":"Jackson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/43a26b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/6","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501119,"name":"John Slagel","username":"Novicaine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T22:03:34.868Z","cooked":"

This tripped me up: By default, the new radio only broadcasts on the 6GHZ band and it turns out that none of our laptops supported 6HGZ wifi, so we couldn’t see that it was working. You have to flip the 3rd dip switch on the bottom of the radio to enable 2.4GHZ operation (temporarily, this isn’t recommended) and then your laptop should be able to see it. But do read the manual to figure out the proper solution which is apparently buying another similar radio that you connect the laptop to via ethernet

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T22:08:16.777Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":72.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56132,"username":"Novicaine","name":"John Slagel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63024,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501133,"name":"Pat Mattin","username":"pmattin5459","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pmattin5459/{size}/182786_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T22:13:50.970Z","cooked":"

To expand on this, there are very few laptops that support Wifi 6e. This is why Vivid recommends having a second radio for practice at home. This is the page you’re looking for.

Only look at the first option. You need a second radio configured as an access point and mounted to a heatsink (we found that a piece of 2x1 works in a pinch, but get a proper heatsink).

If you don’t have a second radio, get a long ethernet cable. 2.4Ghz mode will let you connect to the radio, but it won’t be particularly good for practice, especially in areas with other Wifi routers.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T22:13:50.970Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":178,"readers_count":177,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56132,"username":"Novicaine","name":"John Slagel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/9","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501232,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T00:16:57.298Z","cooked":"

Even more frustrating: Even laptops with Wifi 6E still might not connect to this thing properly.

I’ve tried 5 systems with Wifi 6Ghz support, across a mix of chipsets and operating systems, and two different radios, and not one even sees the 6Ghz network, or connects to it as a hidden network.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T00:16:57.298Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":40.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":27664,"username":"pmattin5459","name":"Pat Mattin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pmattin5459/{size}/182786_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/10","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501243,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T00:24:55.297Z","cooked":"

For legal reasons, the radio on the robot side can only operate as a 6 GHz client, not as an access point. You must have a fixed (plugged into the wall) 6 GHz access point active to operate at 6 GHz; the easiest way to do this is generally to buy a second radio.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T00:26:26.616Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":173.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/11","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501246,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T00:29:20.301Z","cooked":"

AH. That explains things. I knew there was restrictions about battery operation, but did not pair that with the recommendations for a second radio.

I had interpreted the second radio as a workaround for the “Wifi 6E is uncommon and drivers are terrible”, scenario since most teams would have a second for backup anyway.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T00:29:20.301Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":56.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/12","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501270,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T01:12:13.130Z","cooked":"

More information here about wirelessly connecting a laptop to 6GHz:
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home#laptop-direct-to-vh-109

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T01:12:13.130Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home#laptop-direct-to-vh-109","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Practicing At Home | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/13","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501282,"name":"JohnRRRR","username":"JohnRRRR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T01:33:25.339Z","cooked":"

A firmware option to disable 6ghz for use at home when 2.4ghz is enabled might allow teams to stay legit without the complexity of an ac powered second radio that requires 3rd party cooling or a heat sink. Giving teams a thing that is illegal when used in the simplest and most familiar way does not feel like a plan for success.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T01:33:25.339Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"JohnRRRR","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27328,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501301,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T01:58:20.486Z","cooked":"

If the radio is configured as a 6GHz access point and powered via a battery, it will disable itself requiring a power cycle, and remain in the state until it is no longer powered via battery.

So it’s not possible for a team to accidentally do something illegal.

I don’t see a way to turn off 6ghz in the current firmware so it appears to always be configured with it on. The only option is to turn on 2.4Ghz with dip switch 3. The documentation states:

" When configured as a WIRELESS ACCESS POINT , due to regulatory requirements, the VH-109 radio cannot be powered using a battery source and is for Indoor Use Only ."

If the radio has a feature to automatically turn off 6Ghz on battery, I’m confused why the documentation was written this way prohibiting access point use on battery. The only mention of a frequency turning off automatically is the 2.4Ghz if a connection is made to a 6Ghz access point.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":30,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T13:17:01.641Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484979,"topic_slug":"how-to-enable-wireless","display_username":"JohnRRRR","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25039,"username":"FletcherS7","name":"Fletcher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27328,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-enable-wireless/484979/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3501659,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T13:24:33.466Z","cooked":"
JohnRRRR:

If the radio has a feature to automatically turn off 6Ghz on battery, I’m confused why the documentation was written this way prohibiting access point use on battery.

That documentation statement is a regulatory requirement to inform users that it is not legal to operate in this way. The radio does what it can to prevent it, but it’s still illegal if a user bypasses those protections either intentionally or unintentionally.

Why is it not recommended to move the dipswitch and use this as a 2.4 GHz robot radio, then when you get to competition, flip the dipswitch back and use it that way?

The DIP switch controls the enablement of the 2.4GHz AP.
The 6GHz AP is only enabled when the VH-109 is configured as an AP from the config page, by default the VH-109 is in robot radio (client/bridge) mode and won’t act as a 6GHz AP.
